column5: Skol
LOL she doesnt wear her glasses when she looks at me !!!! and she says she will be at lake air with her drinkin cap on...
Take that mixture and market it....and whatever you do....don't change the name!!!

1.5 liter bottle of water while on the lake coors light back home.  doesnt the slogan go water on water beer on the pier????  although i must admit the odd time i get into a boat with a head and drinking is legal it sure is nice to be out there with a few cold ones.  Can you imagine this thread 30 years ago????  lol

well in light of my most recent trip this past weekend on long point bay.....i would have to say JAGER BOMBS and BUSCH are my favourite drinks but then again if i didn't want to be hammered drunk by 9 in the morning my favourite drink would be whatever i buy on the way there...
Ice fishing so far vodka, summer time its rum or beer.

Well since I just started fishing last summer I never really thought or cared about what I'm drinking but as I kept getting up earlier and earlier to go fishing I started to appreciate Tim Hortons a lot more.
I remember going fishing with my father when i was young and when we did he always bought "tahiti treat",,,wish i could find it now for when i take my son fishing!
vodka redbull or coors light
Nobody can drink jager bombs and be successful at fishing...or much else after!  That said, it is probably one of the most popular drinks around campus

lol.....we were in an ice hut.....caught maybe 15 perch lol and i caught a mud puppy....WOHOOO!!!! lol but yeah ur pretty much right....hard to focus when there is jager bombs bein passed around lol....good thing we werent walkin in lol....
beer.  p.-
a little Irish cream in my Thermos of coffee, when thats finished, a big bottle of ice water
On the ice, it has to be beer..... Bitburger is the fav.... of course only if I am not the driver....  Burt

Rob,  Temagami is a special lake that takes a special drink. For me it's 24 of Miller MGD and for playing cards at night it's a bottle of Yukon Jack stuck in the snow bank. email is on its way, enjoy your self up there and be safe.
thank you very much fang...maybe we could share one of those MGD's one day...

Can't beat a Seizure with a natural ice sickle off the roof top for a swizzle. If Ice sickles aren't available, you can always spud some cubes up off the lake.  Second choice is a fishermans Coffee - 4 oz coffee, 2 oz Baileys, 2 oz Jack Daniels.  Silver Bullets - Tequila and Peppermint Schnapps   There's a story behind each one of them there drinks.
piles of booze and pints. piles

In the boat? Ice cold can of coke...not sure why because I dont actually drink much coke but on the water its great. Thats in between water bottles of course, I have a habit of drinking 6-8 bottles of water a day.  On the shore at night waitin for the wallies to take the bait an ice cold moosehead/creemore springs/pabst (only if im broke).  I've been known to have a pint while on the river as well...as long as Im not drivin of course
I don't drink when I'm fishing......too busy catching fish.   When I do drink, I'll take a double gibsons finest with diet 7up please........LOTS of ice.  Sinker
Wow.  This whole thread makes me thirsty. The only time I ever have a rum and coke is when I'm fishing.  I need to fish more often.
I don't know how you guys can pause long enough from fishing to mix a drink! lol

I'd have to say coffee for the early mornings, black coffee of course, the only way to take it.  Then move on to water or iced tea later on in the afternoon.  Back on shore its onto the brews and maybe a couple Caesars.

Easy for me, tournament rules no alcohol in the boat, everyone I knew took it seriously. Most of the time a long drive home after a day on the lake, so it wasn`t a good plan after the tournie.  Places we went to for a two day might a beer or two back at camp in the evening but you wanted to be sharp for the next day.  Boat to me is like a car or truck, don`t have it in them, not in the boat. Fish give me a buzz!

I'm nearly always on the water at least an hour before sunrise, so a large thermos of coffee & cream gets me going in the morning. I also carry a 1 gallon insulated jug with water and if it's gonna be an all day trip, there's usually a couple cans of COKE on ice too.
Hot chocolate and Baileys...  COLD  Scotch...  SEMI COLD  Moosehead or other...  WARM  Gatorade... HOT
Rockstar energy drink, for strong hook sets and the one hundred meter dash!!  I've also been known to sip on a little rye..  HD
Rocket Fuel Always "151" THE BAT RULES
Just lots of Tim Horton's coffee in the morning for me, like some of the other guys I usually don't take the time to drink in between casts. Ice fishing is a different story though.
Very cold died sprite for me and very very cold beer bact at the campsite. Any kind of cold, cold beer.
Coffee and Diet Pepsi..
Coca-Cola

I'm not much of a beer drinker at home, but love Molson Dry on camping trips.  Then there's my curious breakfast concoction that I mixed up one spring trip just to finish everything off.  Equal parts red wine, rum & Tang. I called it a "Magnetewan Sunrise"

summer: Timmies for starters, then cool beer on ice, plus pop and water  ice fishing: we really drink: vodka, crown royal, ouzo and white wine + mixers  ALSO: lots of good ideas on this thread...its been a while since a thread has been worthy of printing off and laminating for reference.
since im not of age yet id have to say a nice cold root beer
douG, You mean to tell me that ain't appo juice in that jug???? LOL
Beer!  OV preferred!  Usually red wine or Moody Blue ice fishing!

Water on the water. BEER on the pier! 'Cept in the morning when two fingers of Irish make their way into the coffee. I might have a few out on the ice if I'm in a heated hut and don't have to drive. Then its probably rye. Maybe beer.
In the winter, a thermos of hot chocolate. ... sometimes a bit of Kahlua  In the summer, 3 bottles of water and 2 red bulls.

was talking with some of my buddies about our temagami trip comming up and we started talking about food and booze.... it always seems to come up when were going away so i thought to myself.. what do other people like to drink when there out fishing... me myself i like a nice cold beer and time to time a rye....
Beer is probably a popular answer.
Pepsi and water... a few of the legal options.
Double -double
water or juice works for me while fishing....right about now though some of Dawgs special elixer would be real good  maureen
Pretty touchy subject these days. For me,I want my wits about me. So I would say during,coffee. When we are back safe and sound.let, er fly.IMO
No alcohol for me while operating a watercraft or motor vehicle!!!  On a 95*F summers day, nothing beats a jug of green Gatorade!!!
RED BULL!!!!!!
long straw into the livewell, never know what its going to taste like
you guys are making me look like an alcoholic...lol maybe i should have said when your out fishing for a weekened with the boys .... whats your favorite drink to bring up with you....
Nice cold Ginger ale or a bottle of water...
Coffee and cigarettes in the morning, Coke and cigarettes during the day, and beer and cigarettes at night (on the dock ofcourse)
When I'm in Canada and the fishing is done for the day, I pretty much suck down the dark Cuban rhum like it's going out of style eh!!!
now thats what im talking about when in rome do as the romans..or should i say canadians

Hot chocolate while I'm ice fishing.. alcohol and caffeine makes you colder, and I'm cold enough as it is! lol  Any other part of the year if I'm out in the boat fishing seriously I usually won't even pick up a bottle of water for 8 hours. Gets kinda dangerous some days in the summer but I never want to stop casting.  If I'm doing some relaxed fishing during warmer months I'll usually have a coffee or jug of water.  Oh.. and off the water after a day of fishing - let the beers fly down!

When my buddy and I camp at the Massasauga every July, we take water on the boat with is and go back to the campsite a couple of times per day to eat, swim and have a couple of beers. We use to take a couple of pints out with us, but not any more. We never got wasted on the water, but get pulled over every year, so it is really not worth the $200 plus fine.
St-Laurent frapp√© when out in the boat and ice cold Coors Light when I get back home. Leechman
It's a good thing Miss Kelly is a fun gal!!!  ... I dunno what she see's in you?!   btw... I'll be bringing up a couple more bottles from the "fountain of youth" to Lakair in June.
Take it easy on those Coors lights Jacques... I can't drink more than aboot 27 or 28 of them without getting a buzz!

i understand what ur saying...couple days in a bungalow or whatever. I like irish cream on ice for a sipper around noo, and some in the coffee in the morning. And rum any time pretty much lol. Rum in hot chocolate is pretty good...and better then it sounds lol.  -R-
Hot, cold, 3 days old. Me and my 1 quart mug of coffee.
Coffee, anytime.
Me, I like a nice glass of 15-20 year old scotch over some ice.
Better whatch it Glen.... that stuff is lethal if you ever get to 29
